intro: Naucleopsis ulei subsp. amara, commonly known as the Amara naucleopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
